title.narrative: COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT TO PREVENT DISCRIMINATION AND DROPOUT

description.narrative: By 2023, SMCs are other duty-bearers increasingly involved in management and are accountable to prevent discrimination and dropout, particularly with regard to the most vulnerable children including in emergencies., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more preschool and school aged children benefit from an equitable, inclusive, quality education and acquire the necessary skills to continue their education or integrate into the labour market

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, SMCs are other duty-bearers increasingly involved in management and are accountable to prevent discrimination and dropout, particularly with regard to the most vulnerable children including in emergencies.

description.narrative: Thanks to the Back to School (BTS) campaign with the Ministry of Education and co-funding from the World Bank, over 1 million vulnerable children were provided with school kits and didactic tools thus facilitating their access to and retention in school. Some 1,362 school management committee members have improved capacity in the management of their schools with greater accountability regarding prevention of dropout, prevention of gender-based violence, in particular for the most vulnerable girls and boys, including in emergency situations. This is a result of a partnership with the NGO FAWE in support of the MoE. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020
